most_active_tickets.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
Workstream activities tab is not working
MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues and LTM Integration Failures
common_issues.description: Multiple reports indicate performance problems with Pieces OS, including Chrome freezes with LTM 2.5 enabled on large webpages, LTM functionality not working in the Pieces CLI, and overall application slowness/unresponsiveness.  Common factors include various Pieces OS versions, Windows and macOS platforms, and different LLM models. Disabling LTM 2.5 seems to resolve the Chrome freezing issue. Further investigation needed for CLI and general slowness.

related_issues.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
related_issues.text:
LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When browsing webpages with large amounts of content and dynamic elements, Chrome freezes when Pieces OS with LTM 2.5 is active. 

[Culprit webpage (Clarity CRM API Docs)](https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document) is ~500 KB raw HTML, ~700 KB total page size. Dynamic element(s) are a scroll linked table of contents.

**What happens:**

* Chrome CPU usage spikes (~50% CPU) during scrolling.
* Memory usage stays stable.
* Chrome freezes for 10-15 seconds, unfreezes, and freezes again when scrolling resumes.
* Disabling LTM 2.5 resolves the freeze (Pieces OS still running).

**Expected:**
Pieces should handle large pages without freezing or jumping while scrolling.

---

### **Steps to Reproduce**

1. Enable LTM 2.5 in Pieces OS 
2. Load a large page (https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document).
3. Scroll through the page.
4. Observe Chrome freeze / become unresponsive as Pieces tries to capture context.
---

### **Environment**

* OS: Windows 11 Pro
* Chrome: 137.0.7151.104
* Pieces OS: 12.0.0
* LTM Version: 2.5
* Pieces Chrome Extension: Tested with and without--same result. 

---

### **Additional Notes**

I observed high-frequency DOM mutations via MutationObserver, but unsure if root cause (found 80-150 DOM mutations per scroll event)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Version 4.2.0 (4.2.0)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been using Pieces for many months and it has been an absolute timesaver. 

Over the last few weeks, 'New chats' have become increasingly slow, often taking many minutes to get the first response.  This week, it is not responding at all, and failing with the error message: 
"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

I have attempted this with and without LTM enabled and have tried different LLM models - Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Clause 3.5 Sonnect, GPT-4o.    This has not resolved things.

I have independently run the same request with GPT-4o in the browser and the request response is very rapid, so the issue appears to be with the Pieces App, rather than with the LLM
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: LTM connection failures and slow performance
common_issues.description: Users report LTM connectivity issues across Pieces CLI and Desktop, including 404 errors for the Gemini-Pro model and timeouts.  Slow performance and unresponsiveness have also been observed, even with different LLM models.  Suggested solutions include verifying LTM settings, checking network connectivity, and ensuring sufficient resources.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Performance Issues and Login Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing login failures due to verification codes not arriving.  Additionally, slow performance, unresponsiveness, and errors have been reported with new chats, workstream summaries, and other cloud-connected features.  A service interruption is currently being investigated, potentially related to cloud service issues or a cyber-related incident.  Data security is not believed to be impacted.

related_issues.title: Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
related_issues.text:
Can't login/authentication message won't arrive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I haven't been online a lot because of personal issues. Yesterday I restarted pieces for the first time in weeks, and it said I needed to sign in before I can continue.
First the sign in link wouldn't work. Then I noticed there was a Pieces OS update too. After I clicked that update I got back to the same screen and the link would work.
So I entered my mail address and it said I should get a verification code, which never arrived. So I tried again later and still nothing happened. I decided to let it rest until today and try it again, but still the same result.

related_issues.title: 🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
related_issues.text:
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
We are currently experiencing a service interruption affecting several cloud-connected features across PiecesOS, the Desktop App, and Pieces Plugins. Specifically, users may notice degraded performance or unresponsiveness in the following areas:

- Copilot responses
- Workstream summaries
- Other cloud-assisted functionalities, such as snippet transforms and snippet discovery

The interruption is tied to unexpected issues with specific cloud services, and we are also actively investigating the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of our root cause analysis.

We want to reassure all users that your data security and privacy are not impacted. As a precaution, our security and infrastructure teams are treating this with the highest level of urgency and diligence. We are taking all necessary steps to investigate and remediate the issue.

Our engineering and security teams are working around the clock to restore full functionality. We’ll continue to provide updates in this thread as we learn more and make progress.

You can track the status of this interruption here and we’ll notify you once normal service has resumed.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have urgent concerns or need support, please reach out via our usual support channels.

The Pieces Team

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: LTM Context Extraction Failure in Pieces
common_issues.description: Users report the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool and Pieces CLI fail to retrieve LTM context, despite LTM functionality within the Pieces desktop app.  The issue occurs across various OS, Pieces versions, and LLM models.  Potential causes include MCP server implementation issues, authentication problems, or data access layer bugs.  Workarounds such as restarting the MCP server and verifying permissions have been unsuccessful.

related_issues.title: MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
related_issues.text:
MCP `ask_pieces_ltm` tool consistently returns "Failed to extract context" despite functional LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS Sequoia 15.5

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

## Bug Report

**Environment:**
- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.5
- Pieces OS: 11.4.4 - Running (PID 699, actively collecting data)
- Pieces App: 4.1.4 - Active with functional LTM workstream
- MCP Server: Pieces MCP server on localhost:39300
- Test Client: Warp Terminal Agent Mode, Claude, direct curl testing

## Problem Description

The `ask_pieces_ltm` MCP tool consistently returns `"Failed to extract context"` with `"isError": true`, despite:

1. ✅ **LTM is working correctly** - User confirmed LTM is collecting data and showing results/summaries in the Pieces workstream
2. ✅ **MCP server communication works** - Can successfully call `create_pieces_memory` and list tools
3. ✅ **Pieces OS is running and active** - Process running with multiple active connections
4. ❌ **Only `ask_pieces_ltm` fails** - Every call to this specific tool fails

## Steps to Reproduce

### 1. Verify MCP Server is Running
```bash
lsof -i :39300
# Shows Pieces OS listening on port 39300 with multiple established connections
```

### 2. Confirm Tools are Available
```bash
curl -N http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse \
  -H 'Accept: text/event-stream' &
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"tools/list"}'
```

**Result:** ✅ Successfully returns tools list with `ask_pieces_ltm` tool schema

### 3. Test create_pieces_memory (Working)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"create_pieces_memory",
      "arguments":{
        "summary":"Test memory",
        "summary_description":"Testing connection"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ✅ `"Long term memory successfully created"`

### 4. Test ask_pieces_ltm (Failing)
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "jsonrpc":"2.0","id":3,"method":"tools/call",
    "params":{
      "name":"ask_pieces_ltm",
      "arguments":{
        "question":"What did I work on today?",
        "chat_llm":"claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
      }
    }
  }'
```

**Result:** ❌ `{"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Failed to extract context"}],"isError":true}`

## Attempted Variations (All Failed)

### Minimal Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "hello",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
}
```

### With Application Sources
```json
{
  "question": "What terminal commands have I run recently?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "application_sources": ["Warp"],
  "connected_client": "Warp"
}
```

### Comprehensive Parameters
```json
{
  "question": "What did I work on today?",
  "chat_llm": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
  "connected_client": "Warp",
  "application_sources": ["Warp", "Google Chrome"],
  "topics": ["terminal", "commands", "recent"],
  "related_questions": ["What was I working on?", "What debugging was I doing?"]
}
```

### Different Application Sources Tested
- `["Warp"]`
- `["Google Chrome", "Safari", "Obsidian"]`
- `["Claude"]`
- Multiple combinations from the schema list

**All variations return the same error.**

## Troubleshooting Attempted

1. ✅ **Restarted Pieces MCP server** - Issue persists
2. ✅ **Verified Pieces OS permissions** - Has necessary macOS permissions
3. ✅ **Confirmed LTM data collection** - User sees active workstream data
4. ✅ **Tested different MCP clients** - Same error in Warp Agent Mode, Claude, and direct curl
5. ✅ **Used proper SSE endpoint** - `/sse` for responses, `/messages` for requests
6. ✅ **Verified JSON-RPC format** - Matches working `create_pieces_memory` calls

## Expected Behavior

The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool should return contextual information from the user's LTM data, similar to how the main Pieces application shows workstream summaries and context.

## Actual Behavior

Every call to `ask_pieces_ltm` returns:
```json
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Failed to extract context"
    }
  ],
  "isError": true
}
```

## Analysis

This appears to be an **MCP server implementation issue** where:

1. The `ask_pieces_ltm` tool is properly registered and callable
2. The MCP communication protocol works correctly
3. The underlying LTM system has data and functions properly
4. There's a disconnect between the MCP tool implementation and the LTM data access layer

## Potential Root Causes

1. **Authentication/Session Issue**: MCP server process may lack proper authentication to access LTM data
2. **Data Access Layer Bug**: `ask_pieces_ltm` implementation may be using incorrect API calls to access LTM
3. **Permissions Issue**: MCP server may not have the same data access permissions as the main Pieces application
4. **Initialization Problem**: LTM access for MCP tools may require additional setup or initialization

## Request

Please investigate the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool implementation in the Pieces MCP server to identify why it cannot access the same LTM data that is clearly available to the main Pieces application.

## Additional Context

- Issue occurs consistently across different MCP clients (Warp, Claude)
- `create_pieces_memory` works perfectly, confirming MCP communication
- LTM is actively collecting and displaying data in the main Pieces app
- No relevant error logs found in system logs or Pieces application logs
- Multiple parameter variations attempted with identical results

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.0.0 Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces OS 12.0.0 Desktop application.  On Linux, the app gets stuck on the initialization screen. On macOS, users are unable to log in due to verification code issues. These problems coincide with a reported service interruption affecting cloud-connected features.  Check the status page for updates and consider reverting to a prior version if possible.

related_issues.title: Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

related_issues.title: 🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
related_issues.text:
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
We are currently experiencing a service interruption affecting several cloud-connected features across PiecesOS, the Desktop App, and Pieces Plugins. Specifically, users may notice degraded performance or unresponsiveness in the following areas:

- Copilot responses
- Workstream summaries
- Other cloud-assisted functionalities, such as snippet transforms and snippet discovery

The interruption is tied to unexpected issues with specific cloud services, and we are also actively investigating the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of our root cause analysis.

We want to reassure all users that your data security and privacy are not impacted. As a precaution, our security and infrastructure teams are treating this with the highest level of urgency and diligence. We are taking all necessary steps to investigate and remediate the issue.

Our engineering and security teams are working around the clock to restore full functionality. We’ll continue to provide updates in this thread as we learn more and make progress.

You can track the status of this interruption here and we’ll notify you once normal service has resumed.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have urgent concerns or need support, please reach out via our usual support channels.

The Pieces Team

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the LTM connection failures and performance issues as they affect multiple products and impact core functionality.
Investigate the login failures and verification code delivery problems impacting macOS users on version 12.0.0.
Address the Pieces OS 12.0.0 initialization issue on Linux to ensure users can access the application.
Provide support and workarounds for users experiencing Chrome freezes with LTM 2.5 enabled on large webpages.
Monitor and address the ongoing service interruption affecting cloud-connected features, keeping users informed of progress.
Review and improve the onboarding process, particularly LTM 2.5 activation, to prevent timeout errors.
Investigate the "Failed to extract context" error in the `ask_pieces_ltm` tool and Pieces CLI.
Gather more data on the unresponsive desktop application and slow performance issues to identify the root cause and potential solutions.
Consider adding more detailed logging to Pieces OS and the desktop application to aid in troubleshooting and faster resolution times.
Proactively communicate with users about known issues and provide updates on resolution progress through the status page and other channels.
